item.title: Install Repository
item.description: Bootstrap sudo mkdir -p /etc/staker-repo curl 'https://keybase.io/saltwaterc/pgp_keys.asc?fingerprint=8E0D38C40089F860005989ACFD6652320303527F' | sudo tee /etc/staker-repo/release-signing-key-2021.gpg.pem cat << 'EOF' | sudo tee /etc/yum.repos.d/staker.repo [staker] name=Mr Staker rpm repository baseurl=https://rpm.staker.ltd/$basearch/ gpgkey=file:///etc/staker-repo/release-signing-key-2021.gpg.pem gpgcheck=1 repo_gpgcheck=1 enabled=1 EOF Install repository package sudo yum -y install staker-repo # you should see this at the end Key imported successfully Running transaction check Transaction check succeeded. Running transaction test Transaction test succeeded. Running transaction Preparing : 1/1 Installing : staker-repo-21.04.01-1.x86_64 1/1 Verifying : staker-repo-21.

item.title: Uninstall Repository
item.description: Procedure We’re sorry to see you go. Please provide feedback if you ran into difficulties and this is the reason for removing our package builds. We make it easy for you to remove everything: sudo yum remove staker-repo That’s it. It removes all our packages, GPG public key exports, and configuration files. It won’t remove the configuration files which you created as we have no way of tracking that.
